title: Elle: ‘I thought I had cancer’
text:
WHEN Elle Macpherson launched her super supplement last year, it seemed a natural progression for a supermodel nicknamed “The Body.” 
But now the 51-year-old has revealed her business venture was the direct result of a cancer scare. 
The mother-of-two said she turned her life around after finding a lump on her breast on her 49th birthday. 
“I thought I had cancer. I was away shooting Britain and Ireland’s Next Top Model , so I couldn’t see my doctor and I was really panicking,” the Australian beauty told Mail Online. 
“It was four weeks before I got the biopsy results, so it was a long-drawn-out and stressful period of not knowing. 
“I was lucky — it was a fibroadenoma [a benign growth of fibrous tissue], but it was a really big warning. I did some soul searching and realised that maybe I was taking the wrong vitamins and minerals, not eating properly and was too stressed.” 'The Body' 
Macpherson, who is married to American billionaire Jeffrey Soffer, said she was burning the candle at both ends and only getting up to four hours sleep a night. 
“I’d put the boys to bed at 9 or 10pm and work until 2am because that was the only quiet time,” she said. 
“Then I’d get up at 6am. I did that for years. I thought I was incredibly productive; I didn’t realise I was burning out my adrenals and hurting myself just from not getting enough sleep.” 
As she approached 50, Macpherson said she realised she needed to maintain her body “from the inside.” Loved up ... supermodel Elle Macpherson with billionaire Jeffrey Soffer. Picture: Splash News Source: Splash News Australia 
She consulted Harley Street nutritionist Dr Simone Laubscher, who introduced her to the idea of an alkaline diet, marking a turning point in her health . 
“I started sleeping more, woke up with more water, ate less red meat, added more fruit and vegetables and within weeks I felt like a completely different person,” Macpherson said. 
“I didn’t realise how these relatively small changes to my routine could make me feel and look so much better.” Natural remedy ... Elle Macpherson with her nutritionist, Dr Simone Laubscher. Picture: Supplied Source: Supplied 
Following her health scare, the entrepreneur set up WelleCo with her Australian business partner Andrea Bux. 
With the help of Dr Laubscher and a team of doctors in Australia, Macpherson developed The Super Elixir and The Super Elixir Nourishing Protein powder. 
“The Super Elixir Nourishing Protein is an alkalising base of pea and sprouted brown rice protein with all nine amino acids sourced from the smoothest organic ingredients,” she said. 
“If I come home very late from work, then — rather than going to bed on an empty stomach or eating the kids’ leftovers — I’ll make a protein shake.” Natural beauty
